page.title: 08RIDING ON ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: Riding is a very popular pursuit in this area. There are two riding centres and the many summer horse shows and gymkhanas are well supported. Bridlepaths crisscross the Forest and riders obtain a permit from the Conservators to exercise their horses and ponies. Occasionally the bridlepaths are closed due to weather or over-riding. The local hunt uses the Forest amid some controversy, although it has been a hunting ground since the 13th century. Keeping a horse is expensive if the rider has no private grazing and stabling.
